text: Ro: Hey guys, it's Ro, welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!
Today I have a very special guest, it's Joey!
Joey: Yay! I'm back!
Ro: I am so excited you're here! He is the perfect guest for today because
I've got a lot of requests to make something from Ready Player One.
Joey: I'm freaking out. This is honestly one of my favorite books that I've ever read so...
thank you for choosing me.
Ro: For those who don't know anything about the novel or the you know, the movie
it's a sci-fi story, it's a dystopian future.
So Joey knows all about that, you're an expert.
Joey: Yes. And I love video games, I love VR.
Ro: And I don't want to give out too many spoilers, but we're living in this world
that's very over populated there's an energy crisis and living standards aren't very good,
and everyone is playing this game called "Oasis".
Joey: Yeah to like basically escape the harsh reality of what the future has become.
Ro: And the creator of the game is a billionaire, very successful and he has said that
he has hidden 3 keys and if you can find the 3 keys, you inherit his wealth and game so...
everybody is playing this game trying to find the 3 keys.
Ro: Today we are going to make cookies that look like the 3 keys.
So there is going to be one that's copper, one that's green for jade
and one that's decorated white to look like the crystal key.
Joey: Ugh! The crystal key!
Ro and Joey: Spoilers, spoilers, spoilers! Stop! Don't watch! Stop!
Ro: Skip ahead like 30 seconds.
So the second key, the green key, is found in a box - a cereal box of... Joey: Cap'n Crunch.
Ro: Yep. So today in honor of that we are going to be making sugar cookies, but they're Cap'n Crunch
sugar cookies to look like the three keys.
Ro and Joey: Let's get started!
Ro: The things you will need will be:
1/2 cups of all purpose flour, 1 tablespoon of corn meal, 3/4 cup sugar,
1/2 cup of unsalted butter,  some Cap'n Crunch cereal - you will need enough for 6 tablespoons ground.
Joey: 1/2 teaspoon butter extract, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder,
1/4 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 a teaspoon of vanilla extract.
Ro and Joey: Now let's put it all together!
Ro: First step to bake these cookies is grinding up our Cap'n Crunch cereal.
Joey, have you used a food processor before?
Joey: I have not, but I've used a blender. Ro: Very similar. Joey: iJustine has taught me - when in doubt, just blend it.
Ro: It's a good rule of thumb and I couldn't knock her methods because it actually worked.
We made a cake together. Joey: Oh really? Ro: And we mixed it together in a blender
instead of like a stand mixed and it tasted delicious so...
Ro: Alright, pour it in, all in.
Joey: Oh no!
Ro: Maybe just one... Joey: Our fallen solidiers... oh, okay!
Ro: Now we just pulse, so Joey I'mma have you pulse it. You just go boom, boom, boom, boom. Like that, go!
Joey: *squeals* Ro: *laughs* Very powerful! I'll hold it in place.
Joey: That's frightening!
Ro: Joey, we've done it, that's it. Nice work. Joey: Thank you, thank you.
Ro: Joey, I might have you the sharp part so don't... be careful.
Just put that over there or something.
Ro: And then we've got to measure out 6 of these, and these are tablespoon measurements.
That's what we want. Now... oh my gosh.
This is like the bottom of the box, in a cereal box. Joey: Yes! The best part.
Joey: When it sprinkles into the milk and you're just like "oh yes!"
Joey: Alrighty, so our Cap'n Crunch is all blended up and now it's time to mix it up with
a whisk with our other dry ingredients in a medium sized bowl.
Ro: Yeah, there you go Joey, just pour it all in.
The flour, some salt, baking powder - boop boop boop - last but not least, a little cornmeal.
Ro: Mix it up until everything is well combined and set it off to the side.
Ro: Now we cream together the butter and sugar in a large bowl.
So I'm going to pour in the sugar, the butter. Using an electric hand mixer, mix together
until light and fluffy. This usually takes a couple minutes.
Joey: Has your hair every got caught in there?
Joey: Flashback. Ro: When.. yes. To just the other week, true story, I basically blew out the engine.
It like started smoking, full smoke. I was making a meringue.
Joey: Too much baking. Ro: Yeah. It was too much baking.
Joey: So now we are going to add the butter extract and vanilla extract.
Ro: And our egg. You want to add the whole egg and then once again
mix together until well combined. Joey, can you hold the bowl?
Joey: You got it. Ro: 'Cause this one doesn't have a grippy at the bottom.
So sometimes it likes to slide all over.
Ro: *making engine-like noises*
Joey: So we have our wet ingredients and our dry ingredients.
Ro: Eyeball it, just shake in half of the dry ingredients, then we'll mix it up and add the other half.
Ro: Here we go, here we go.
Ro: *making engine-like noises again*
Ro: I like to do the sound effects.
Ro and Joey: The other half.
Ro: Shake, shake, shake. Joey Imma have you mix now.
Joey: I get to do the honors. Ro: Yeah! And I'll scrape down the sides.
Ro: Go for it. Yeah, spin it in circles, you got this.
Joey: Wow, we've got- we've got a problem.
Ro: Okay so you have to hover it in the bowl and put it on a speed and it'll flick out.
Joey: I think you're supposed to eat the stuff that's still on here.
Ro: Okay, push the top button. Joey: No, I'm just kidding! Ro: I'll hold on!
Ro: Trust me!
Ro: Oh what! Joey: Wow!
Joey: A treat! We get to eat everything! Ro: And a little treat for each of us.
Ro: We're going to wrap it up tight using some food safe plastic wrap.
Imma have you do it, I have faith, you can do this.
Joey: Okay. Ro: Okay, use you hands, just ball it together.
Ro: Yeah, yeah, yeah! Joey: Wooo!! Ro: Nice, yeah!
Ro: Then right in the middle.
Push it flat, to look like a pancake, like a little disc.
Then I'm going to go bloop, then hit me back, come this way. Joey: It's like wrapping a present.
Ro: Yeah! Now pop it in the fridge for one hour to chill.
Joey: Alrighty, so it's been a full hour, our dough is chilled and now we have to roll it out.
Ro: That's right, we have to open this up and Joey, I'm going to let you do some baking flair.
Ro: So you just grab a hold and pull it up and it's going to flip in the air
and the goal is to land it on the counter. Don't think  about it.
Joey: Okay, ready? Ro: And just go for it.
Joey: One... Ro: You got this Joey! Joey: Two... Ro: Moral support! Joey: Three!
Ro: Yes! We'll take it!
Ro: It landed on the counter! Joey: It didn't land on the floor so that's a- a plus.
Ro: Alright so now we roll it out. Put down a piece of parchment paper so it won't stick.
Just roll it about a 1/4 inch thick.
Joey: Okay, is this good? Ro: Yeah, that looks great. We go there. Joey: Perfect.
Ro: Now it's time to cut out our cookies. I found this cute little key cookie cutter online.
I'll put a link down below if you're interested in using this one. But they have a bunch
of 'em online. Just cut out a bunch.
Ro: And then we'll place them over here on a baking sheet lined with a piece of parchment paper.
This cookie recipe does expand when it bakes so give them about an inch and half, maybe even 2 inches
inbetween each cookie 'cause it - fwoomp - it fluffs out.
Joey: Let's just cook one at a time.
Ro: Yeah... I like that. One we get to hang out more, two we'd watch movies or something.
Ro: *whispers* What about sci-fi movies?
Joey: Our cookies are on the cookie sheet now let's pop it in the freezer for ten minutes
Ro: Yes we do this so they'll hold the shape while they bake. And heat your oven to  350 degrees
then bake for ten minutes.
Joey: Alrighty, so the cookies are all done and baked and we gave them some time to cool.
Ro: Yeah!
Joey: So we can decorate them now.
Ro: It's super easy. We are going to be frosting them 3 different colors.
The colors of the keys in the game. Or as close to them as we can.
Ro: So the first thing is to outline the cookie.
We pipe an outline all the way around to make your design.
And then we let it sit for about ten minutes to dry.
Ro: Have you ever iced a cookie before? Joey: Never have I ever. I have actually done gingerbread cookies
Joey: But nothing like this.
Joey: So our outlines are looking pretty good, huh?
Ro: Oh yeah! Look at these. Joey: Can we fill them in now?
Ro: Yeah. They've dried, they've set. Now just fill them in.
This is called "flooding". So you just fill them in. Just fill in all of your
cookies with matching colors.
Joey: Okay, so they're all filled in. Ro: Yes! Joey: This is actually a lot of fun.
Joey: I want to do more.
Ro: It's really relaxing. Okay, you've got to come bake again. Joey: Okay, fine.
Ro: There is one more step, it's totally optional. These cookies are ready to serve right now
and they look like the keys from the game.
But I wanted to add a little bit of extra something. Just a little bit of shimmer.
Ro: So, here, do you want to do the crystal one? Joey: Yes! I do.
Ro: So just take a little paintbrush and just lightly put them on top so they shimmer like the metals.
Joey: Wow! This is so cool.
Ro: Isn't this neat? I love it. It just gives it a little extra oomph.
Ro and Joey: Ta-da!!
Ro: Here are the Cap'n Crunch cookies that we made today in celebration of Ready Player One.
And a big thank you to Joey. Joey thank you for helping me bake today.
Joey: Thank you. This is honestly everything. Like I said I'm obsessed with Ready Player One
so the fact that I got to bake something from the book, soon to be movie, is just everything.
Ro: And I feel like it's super themed because it is a delicious Cap'n Crunch cookie recipe
so also if you love the cereal Cap'n Crunch you may love this cookie recipe.
You'll want to check it out.
Ro: I'll be posting a bunch of pictures and the recipe on rosannapansino.com, instagram, facebook and twitter.
You can check it out there and if you guys makes these cookies please take a picture and send it to me
I love seeing your baking creations, it just makes me happy, it makes my day.
And if you're into sci-fi, dystopian-community stuff, like Ready Player One, you will love Joey.
Joey: Oh! Ro: Yeah! Ro: You're like... yeah!
Ro: So I'm going to be putting links down below to Joey's channel. Go check it out, show him some love.
Joey: And if you have any ideas for some future Nerdy Nummies, uh, let us know
in the comments below. Ro: Yeah!
Ro: Lemme know down below! Alright thanks again you guys!
Bye-bye!
